page.title: 09FOXLOW FARM
page.content: We went to interview the owners of the farm. They live in the new farmhouse they built four and a half years ago. His parents live in the old farmhouse in which the remains of a medieval barn can be seen. The farm used to be bigger, but about 11 years ago they sold some land to {Barretts}who built the{Foxlow Housing Estate.}As a result they were able to buy the Staden Grange farm land but they lost their lowest and most sheltered land. Therefore they decided not to keep sheep any more. Now the farm is a dairy and beef farm with a few pigs. They have fields with hay which they use to make silage. There are 2 full time workers. In winter the farmer's wife milks the cows each day and in the summer she runs a guest house.
